item.title: Building Your Own Iot Monitoring Solution
item.description: 📝 Introduction The Internet of Things (IoT) market is rapidly expanding, with revenues expected to reach $947.50 billion in 2024 worldwide and projected to grow to $1,560.00 billion by 2029, according to Statista. This growth spans across consumer, industrial, automotive, smart cities, and smart finance sectors, with automotive IoT leading the way. In the IoT ecosystem, monitoring and dash-boarding are crucial for real-time data visualization, anomaly detection, and proactive maintenance. While numerous commercial solutions exist, building your own monitoring system can offer unique advantages in flexibility, cost-effectiveness, and data privacy.

item.title: About
item.description: About Hi there 👋 I’m Ioannis (Giannis) Vasilopoulos. I currently live in Prague and work as an AI Solutions Engineer at Siemens. Projects Industrial Edge Playground: A scalable platform to create on-demand environments for customers to try out Industrial Edge applications. IoT Dashboard with Docker: Store and monitor temperature and humidity data using container services. Pharmaceutical Drying Web Application: A web application for modeling and visualization of the pharmaceutical drying process (not supported).

item.title: whoami: Ioannis, Giannis, or Yannis? 🇬🇷 issues.
item.description: If you are reading this, chances are you’re one of my colleagues. Hello there 🤗 Perhaps you have noticed me sending private messages as Giannis, or Yannis. However, in official documents and professional settings, my name is listed as “Ioannis” 🤔 Unfortunately, I don’t possess multiple identities 😄 My name is officially Ιωάννης, which directly translates to English as Ioannis. However, this sounds too formal in common Greek, and thus its diminutive form, Γιάννης, is preferred.
